snippet: As Arab and Western states confronted Russia over its refusal to sign on to a call for President Bashar al-Assad to leave power, violence continued without pause in Syria.
abstract: Debate over Syria moves to the United Nations, as Western powers and much of the Arab world confront Russia over its refusal to condemn the Syrian government for its violent suppression of popular protests; the two sides disagree over a draft Security Council resolution that calls for Syria's Pres Bashar al-Assad to leave power as the first step of a transition toward democracy.

byline.contributor: Nada Bakri contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon, and Ellen Barry from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: As Arab and Western states confronted Russia over its refusal to sign on to a call for President Bashar al-Assad to leave power, violence continued without pause in Syria.

headline.main: At U.N., Pressure Is on Russia for Refusal to Condemn Syria
headline.print_headline: At U.N., Pressure Is on Russia For Refusal to Condemn Syria
